Imprint.Description: The Skaven, sometimes known as the Ratmen, the Ratkin or the Children of the Horned Rat, are a malevolent and diabolical race of large humanoid rat-creatures that inhabit a massive inter-continental underground empire known in their tongue simply as the Under-Empire, where at the very heart of Skavendom lies the horrific city of Skavenblight, the species capital city and the probable birthplace of the Skaven race. The Skaven as a whole are a cruel, treacherous, and highly numerous species that have since spread their loathsome corruption to the farthest corners of the Warhammer World. From deep below the earth, these scavengers have built a vast Empire, whose military power and incomprehensible numbers have the potential to smother the kingdoms of the Old World in a seething tide of violence and anarchy. It is believed by all of Skaven-kind that the world is destined to be theirs, for they consider themselves the Supreme Master Race, undeniably superior in every way to all the other races of the World

Weapon.Name: The Fellblade
Weapon.Rule: Wound wielder with no armour save at the end of each turns on a 3+
Weapon.Description: The Fellblade's wielder has Strength 10. Each unsaved wound is multiplied into D6 wounds. Roll a dice at the end of the wielder s turn: on a 3+ there is no effect; on a roll of 1-2 the wielder suffers 1 wound with no armour save allowed

Weapon.Name: The Gouger
Weapon.Description: No armour saves are allowed against wounds caused by the Gouger

Weapon.Name: Blade of Black Fury
Weapon.Description: The sword confers +2 Attacks to the wielder

Weapon.Name: Warpstone stars
Weapon.Rule: As many Warpstone Stars in a single Shooting phase as Attacks on profile, Strength 5 and each unsaved wound multiplies into D3 wounds
Weapon.Description: The model can throw as many Warpstone Stars in a single Shooting phase as it has Attacks on its profile (all against the same target). Treat them as normal throwing stars, but with a range of 10" and Strength 5. Each unsaved wound is multiplied into D3 wounds

Weapon.Name: Weeping Blade
Weapon.Description: The wielder has +1 Strength. Each unsaved Wound is multiplied into D3 wounds

Weapon.Name: Cursed Blade of Delirium
Weapon.Description: The wielder's Weapon Skill is raised to 10

Weapon.Name: Headsplitter
Weapon.Description: This is treated as a normal sling, but against models with Toughness 5 or more, it always wounds on a 2+ with no armour saves allowed

Weapon.Name: Desolate Blade
Weapon.Description: The sword confers +2 Strength to all close combat attacks made by the wielder

Weapon.Name: Dwarf-slayer
Weapon.Rule: Armour saves suffer a -3 against Dwarfs
Weapon.Description: Against Dwarfs, the wielder always wounds on a 2+. Armour saves suffer a -3 modifier, regardless of the wielder s Strength

Weapon.Name: Blade of Corruption
Weapon.Rule: Once an enemy has suffered an unsaved wound, he must roll a dice at the beginning of each of his turns, on 1-3 he will suffer one wound, with no armour save allowed
Weapon.Description: Once an enemy has suffered an unsaved wound from this weapon, he must roll a dice at the beginning of each of his turns. On a roll of 1-3 he will suffer one wound, with no armour save allowed

Weapon.Name: Languisher Sword
Weapon.Description: The wielder of the sword always strikes first in close Combat, even before enemies that have charged. If the wielder is fighting another enemy who is also entitled to strike first (because of spells, special abilities, etc), then resolve attacks in Initiative order. It both combatants' Initiative values are equal, roll a dice to determine who strikes first

Weapon.Name: Death Globes
Weapon.Description: The character can throw one Globe per shooting phase. Place the small round template with its centre nywherc within 8" of the character. Scatter the template and resolve hits as you would for a Stone Thrower template. All models hit suffer a wound on the result of a 4+ with no armour save allowed. If you roll a Misfire, centre the template on the model throwing the globe

Weapon.Name: Blade of Nurglitch
Weapon.Rule: Enemy lose 1 point of Toughness for each unsaved wound
Weapon.Description: Enemy models lose 1 point of Toughness from their profile for each unsaved wound they suffer, to a minimum of Toughness 1

Weapon.Name: Things-Catcher
Weapon.Description: This weapon requires two hands to use and comers the Killing Blow special ability

Armour.Name: Rust Armour
Armour.Rule: If the wearer is wounded by a hit with a Strength sufficiently high to completely cancel his armour save (or a hit that does not allow armour saves), the wound is discounted but the armour falls to pieces and is destroyed
Armour.Description: Gives a 5+ Armour save that can be Combined with other armour as normal. In addition, if the wearer is wounded by a hit with a Strength sufficiently high to completely cancel his armour save (or a hit that does not allow armour saves at all, such as from a cannon ball), the wound is discounted but the armour falls to pieces and is destroyed

Armour.Name: Warpstone Armour
Armour.Rule: Strength 4 hit against enemy for each successful armour save
Armour.Description: Warpstone Armour gives its wearer a 4+ armour save. For each successful armour save made by the bearer in close combat, the armour immediately inflicts a Strength 4 hit against the model that struck the blow

Armour.Name: Cautious Shield
Armour.Rule: Can force one model in base contact to lose 1 Attack (2 Attack if decide not to attack enemy)
Armour.Description: Gives a 6+ armour save rhat can he combined with other armour as normal. The bearer can force one model in base contact to lose 1 Attack (he can choose which Attack in the case of opponents with different Attacks, such as cavalry models).\n\nIn addition, the model can decide not to attack at all, but to wield the shield with jwo hands and concentrate on defence. If he decides to do this, the chosen enemy will lose 2 Attacks. The player must declare which way the shield will be used at the beginning of each Close Combat phase, before any side strikes blows

Additional.Name: Twisted Crown of the Horned Rat
Additional.Description: The Twisted Crown gives the wearer the Regeneration ability

Additional.Name: Tenebrous Cloak
Additional.Rule: 3+ Ward save against normal and magical missiles
Additional.Description: This item confers a 3+ Ward save to the wearer against normal and magical missiles

Additional.Name: Foul Pendant
Additional.Description: The pendant confers a 5+ Ward save to the bearer

Additional.Name: Warpstone Amulet
Additional.Rule: At the end of the game roll a D6: on the result of 1, the character counts as a casualty
Additional.Description: The Amulet confers to the bearer a 4+ Ward save. At the end of the game roll a D6. On the result of 1, the character succumbs to the mutating power of the warpstone and counts as a casualty for the purposes of allocating Victory points, and cannot contest table quarters. No re-rolls are allowed for this final roll

Additional.Name: Ring of Darkness
Additional.Description: The bearer and the unit he is with have Magic Resistance (1). Also, when a spell, magic item or any other scrying magic would force the Skaven player to reveal magic items or any other 'hidden' presence in the unit, the Skaven player must only reveal the presence of this ring. Everything else remains hidden

Additional.Name: Cloak of Shadows
Additional.Rule: In order to shoot or cast a spell, enemy units first need to roll a 5 or 6 on a D6
Additional.Description: In order to shoot or cast a spell against the bearer, enemy units first need to roll a 5 or 6 on a D6. If they fail, they can choose a different target, choose to cast a different spell, etc. It the bearer is inside a unit or is engaged in close combat, the cloak has no effect

Additional.Name: Skalm
Additional.Rule: Once at the beginning of any phase may cures of any wounds
Additional.Description: Use once, at the beginning of any phase (own or enemy's). Skalm cures all wounds suffered so far by the bearer

Weapon.Name: Brass Orb
Weapon.Description: Once per battle, the user can throw the orb exactly like a Death Globe. Models hit must take an Initiative test or be destroyed, with no saves (of any kind) allowed. Remember that a 6 is always a failure, but characters are allowed a 'Look Out Sir!' roll as normal. An Empire Steam Tank hit by the orb suffers 3D6 points Of damage

Additional.Name: Skavenbrew
Additional.Description:
A character can feed Skavenbrew to the unit he is with at the beginning of the battle. The Skavenbrew will have no effect on other characters in the unit. Roll a D6 to determine the effect of the Skavenbrew:

D6 Result

1 No effect.

2-3 The unit and the character are frenzied.

4-5 The unit and the character bate all enemies.

6 The unit and the character are frenzied and hate all enemies (despite being immune to psychology due to frenzy). In addition, the unit suffers D3 wounds from overexertion at the end of every Skaven turn (distribute them as missile hits, no armour save allowed)

Weapon.Name: Liber Bubonicus
Weapon.Description: The bearer is a Level 1 Wizard, but has no Warpstone tokens. He knows the Pestilent Breath spell

Weapon.Name: Bands of Power
Weapon.Rule: Bound spell, Power Level 4, Once per Magic phase doubles the model's basic Strength value until the beginning of his side's following Magic phase
Weapon.Description: Once per Magic phase, the user can cast the spell bound within the bracers. The spell requires no Power dice to cast as all the power is provided by the bands. The spell doubles the model's basic Strength value until the beginning of his side's following Magic phase

Weapon.Name: Warpstone Charm
Weapon.Rule: May re-roll any single dice roll once during the game
Weapon.Description: This item allows its bearer to re-roll any single dice roll once during the game. This can even be used to effectively cancel a Miscast or cause Irresistible-Poire

Arcane.Name: Warpstorm Scroll
Arcane.Rule: Bound spell, Power Level 5, All flying units, flying monsters and their riders within 24" suffer D6 Strength 6 hits, one use only
Arcane.Description: All units ol flyers within 24" of the caster suffer D6 Strength 6 hits. Flying monsters and their riders within range also suffer D6 Strength 6 hits, randomised like shooting hits

Arcane.Name: Warp Scroll
Arcane.Rule: Bound spell, Power Level 5, One Strength 3 hit on every model in the unit (Panic test if the unit suffers any casualties), one use only
Arcane.Description: The scroll's spell has a range of 24" and can be cast on any unit which is visible to the bearer. The spell contained in the scroll inflicts one Strength 3 hit on every model in the unit. If the unit suffers any casualties, it must take a Panic test

Arcane.Name: Storm Daemon
Arcane.Rule: Bound spell, Power Level 4, Once in each Magic phases, cast the Warp Lightning spell (the weakest version only), roll a D6 even time it is used: on a 1 the Storm Daemon cannot be used for the rest of the battle
Arcane.Description: Once in each of his own Magic phases, the bearer can cast the Warp Lightning spell (the weakest version only). The spell requires no Power dice to Cast as all the power is provided by the Storm Daemon itself.\n\nRoll a D6 even time it is used. On a 1 the Storm Daemon runs out of power and cannot be used for the rest of the battle

Arcane.Name: Eye of The Horned Rat
Arcane.Rule: Roll a D6: on 2-6 add one Power dice to the Power dice pool, if a 1 is rolled one dice is removed from the pool
Arcane.Description: The Wizard can decide to activate the Eye at the beginning of each of his Magic phases. On a result of 2-6 add one Power dice to the Power dice pool. If a 1 is rolled, no dice are added to the pool and instead one dice is removed from the pool

Arcane.Name: Warpstone Tokens
Arcane.Description: In a similar way to scrolls, all Skaven wizards in the army can buy as many Warpstone tokens as they can afford within the limit of the points they can spend on magic items. Buying one or more tokens does not count taking Arcane item

Banner.Name: Storm Banner
Banner.Rule: Missile fire is at -2 to hit
Banner.Description: The banner can be activated at the beginning of any player’s turn. No flying movement is allowed across the entire battlefield and missile fire is at -2 to hit. All non-magical missile attacks that don’t use BS to hit their target need to roll a 4+ on a D6 before they can fire. Roll a D6 at the beginning of each following player turn - the effects of the banner will end on a D6 roll of 1 or 2

Banner.Name: Sacred Banner of the Horned Rat
Banner.Description: All models in the unit cause fear

Banner.Name: Umbranner
Banner.Rule: 4+ Ward save against all normal and magical missiles with Strength 4 or less
Banner.Description: All models in the unit carrying the banner receive a 4+ Ward save against all normal and magical missiles with Strength 4 or less

Banner.Name: Banner of The Four Black Winds
Banner.Rule: Flying-models must use their ground movement value to charge the unit
Banner.Description: Flying-models wishing to charge the unit carrying the banner must use their ground movement value and cannot use their flying movement to charge

Banner.Name: Banner of burning hatred
Banner.Description: The unit hates all enemies, even if the unit is normally immune to psychology because of frenzy. Roll a Do6 at the beginning of each of the unit's Movement phases if the unit is not declaring a charge. On a roll of 1-3 the unit has to move as fast as it can towards the closest enemy it can see

Banner.Name: Banner of the Swarm
Banner.Rule: Outnumber bonus +2 instead of the normal +1
Banner.Description: If the unit carrying the banner is fighting in a combat where its side outnumbers the enemy, the "outnumber enemy' bonus is +2 instead of the normal +1

Lord.Name: Gray Seer Thanquol
Lord.Description: Grey Seer Thanquol is arguably one of the most cunning, devious and perhaps the most ambitious Skaven Sorcerer to have ever lived, having worked previously as High Emissary in the service of the tyrannical Council of Thirteen. Considered by himself as being one of the most talented and ingenious minds the Under-Empire has ever known, Thanquol has served many roles within the Skaven hierarchy, having worked as a skilled diplomat and politician for many powerful Warlords and Generals. This prestigious role has garnered him an immense fortune in both wealth and magical power.

Original.Rule: Can re-roll the dice by Warpstone token then rolls a 1

Armour.Name: Amulet of the Horned One
Armour.Rule: At the beginning of each turns regains a single Wound on roll of 5+

Lord.Name: Throt
Lord.Description: Throt the Unclean is one of the most twisted and ingenious Master Mutators of Clan Moulder and has exploited that success to position himself as one of the nine Lords of Hell Pit. The effects of a lifetime's work with warpstone can be seen, as bone spines protrude out of Throt's back and a third arm sprouts out of his bloated but powerful frame.

Original.Rule: Re-roll any single dice roll once during the game
May never pursue a fleeng enemy they have broken in combat

Lord.Name: Warlord
Lord.Description: To hold the title of Warlord is to rule supreme. In battle these brutal, back-stabbing commanders will do anything for victory, leading from the back, a nice safe place where he can watch the flow of battle and decide where his sword arm is needed most.

Lord.Name: Gray Seer
Lord.Description: The Grey Seers are powerful sorcerers, capable of channeling eldritch energies in destructive ways - levelling armies with lightning, or summoning ravening swarms of rats. As chief agents for the Horned Rat, Grey Seers wield tremendous influence amongst the warlord clans, and only a fool would ignore their council.

Hero.Name: Chieftain
Hero.Description: Skaven Chieftains, or Clan Chieftains, are among the highest ranking warriors within a Skaven Clan, who are often given control over a smaller segment of the Clan to rule as they see fit.
